Spotting your heroes

  • Posted: October 14, 2014
  • / By: admin
Imagine yourself sitting in a bar with your friends, chatting about music. When suddenly your favorite musician comes in, sites next to you and starts chatting you up. He’s really nice, answering your questions personally and everything.
Spot.IM is a great platform to meet up, get to know people and chat live about your passion verticals. A great way to get your community excited about your website and your Spot is taking a passion vertical and making it tangible by hosting a live Q&A in the Spot with well known figure in that field.
One of our great partners, the world’s biggest selling weekly rock magazine, Kerrang! Decided to boost up their Spot with a live Q&A. Hosting Frank Iero, a guitarist and backing vocalist for the extremely popular group “My Chemical Romance”. Frank is putting out a new solo album “Stomachaches” this month and he came to the Spot to give his fans an opportunity to talk to him personally about it.
The response to the event was amazing!
Kerrang! And Frank Iero started promoting the event 4 days beforehand through their websites and social media. In those 4 days the community tripled! A few hours before the event the community was already buzzing in the spot, it felt just like a rock concert, with people coming early to get their spot (pun intended) in the front row center.
The Q&A itself was, as Frank himself phrased it, “Crazy fun”. A discussion that was meant to go on for 30 minutes went on for almost an hour because Frank enjoyed it so much he staid voluntarily. With more then users 350 online, at some point 45 typing simultaneously, sending almost 10,000 messages and 4,898 likes the event was “Chaos, but really fun” as our friends in Kerrang! summed it up.
To help the Q&A run smoothly, our content team monetized the conversation by kicking out trolls and spammers. In orders for users not to miss Frank’s answers, we pined each answer to the top of the Spot.

Following up the Q&A Kerrang! posted this awesome 26 things we learned from Frank Iero’s Q&A, making the best out of the Spot’s user generated content by creating new content.

Want to host a Q&A in your Spot or get more tips and tricks for making your community bigger and better? Contact Shirley Kleinman, Head of Strategic Relationships at shirley@spot.im
Create a Spot Now: www.Spot.IM
